name: Adobe Village Graham Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything about Adobe Village is absolutely 'tops' - from the decor of the rooms to the superior management by Innkeepers Ron and Cheryl. My family group expressed unanimous satisfaction with our three day stay.
reviews.title: Simply terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful small courtyard frames the back area...lovely bronze outdoor sculptures.
reviews.title: Lovely view of Sedona red rocks from common room; owners are worn out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was home away from home with all service provided from kind and friendly staffs. All I and my wife did were relax and enjoy the free time doing lots of hiking. We enjoyed the Bell Rock view from our room and to the trail is within working distance. One of friendly staff suggested to us to what/where to visit/see during our 4 days stay which gave us remakable experience. Breakfast and afternoon snacks are just another treat.
reviews.title: getaway from work for both of us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this bed-and-breakfast was superb. There was a gorgeous view from the deck off our room and an even better one from the breakfast area. Though we didn't use the pool, the area around it sported a rich assortment of birds that made relaxing poolside that much better. The room was very comfortable and spacious, not to mention clean and well appointed. The staff was very friendly and very helpful in choosing restaurants and activities. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful, as were the afternoon snacks. It is very convenient to hiking and touring and to Sedona. We highly recommend the Adobe Village Graham Inn to anyone traveling to the area.
reviews.title: Can't Imagine a Nicer Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the earliest part of the Sedona area you come to from I-17, which saves on traffic and sales tax, and is situated among some of the prettiest mountains. Since this area has built up, it has plenty of attractions close by, including some great restaurants and excellent walking trails. The hotel is a Bed and Breakfast, with the most unusual breakfasts we have ever experienced in similar places. The owners have a good balance between offering friendly service without being intrusive. The hotel gives the feel of being more isolated and private than it actually is in regard to close proximity to other buildings and roads. Our room was the least expensive, yet very nicely decorated and romantic enough to celebrate our 44th anniversary. We had a great time rekindling our romance!
reviews.title: Private, Romantic Setting

likes.liked: — Varied decor and breakfasts, plus seclusion
likes.disliked: — Almost out of my price range as a semi-retired person on Social Security

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me & my girlfriend just wanted a quick escape from city life and all the hectics that come with it, I looked and grabbed the 1st one kind of quickly not really looking into what i got into thoroughly...i kinda just went my customer rating. Very surprisingly it was well beyond what I expected!! My girlfriend loved it!! It was the perfect escape, It was actually the best experience I've ever had with the opposite sex in my life...I will never forget AVGI, and I plan to be back next time i go to Sedona. I also had a spectacular dinner at an authentic italian restaraunt right down the street. the only complaint I had was that it didnt last longer!!!
reviews.title: The perfect escape from reality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Sunset Villa which is a very large, very private room with high ceilings, 2 fireplaces, large walk-in closet, wet bar (with mini-fridge, microwave oven, and even a dishwasher).. A small table set for two makes even having take-out feel special. The jacuzzi tub sits next to a scenic window in the bathroom and is specially designed for the comfort of 2 people.. Expansive floor-to-ceiling windows framing a gorgeous red rock view from the custom-made wrought iron king bed is the icing on the cake! Loved our stay!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Place, Peaceful Setting..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No fitness center, but "Snap 24-7" is a very nice brand new gym located just a few blocks away and you can buy a 2 person, 4 day pass for $35..
reviews.title: Best Bed and Breakfast experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: No MP3 player, so bring a few CDs for the stereo (flush mount ceing speakers are also a nice touch!)
reviews.title: Typical Sedona, magnificent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: A better home away from home. Friendly staff, great ambiance, and food that rivals most fine dining. Would highly recommend the Sundance Room, which features a double sided fireplace; one side faces the jetted jacuzzi tub and the other bedside. Thanks Ron for making us feel welcome.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ...and the fact that it is located a couple miles south of Sedona was a blessing. We were able to avoid the droves of tourists walking around the shops and stay close to two Vortex spots...Bell Rock was a couple blocks away and the most famous Cathedral Rock was only a short 5 minutes drive around the way.
reviews.title: Very hospitable staff, great location, cozy facility...highly recommed it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They will also accommodate your Vegan diet which was great for my girlfriend...just let them know ahead of time if possible...especially if you book through Expedia...When I return to Sedona I will definitely try to stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled with another couple to Sedona for one night and stayed in the Sedona Suite, and was perfect for two couples or a small family. We were pampered with all the great amenities and food. We will definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: My boyfriend and I stayed in the cozy Sundance Room -- absolutely perfect for a quiet and romantic weekend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Adobe Village Graham Inn is a beautiful bed & breakfast just outside Sedona proper. We are avid hikers and were able to walk out the front door and commence hiking among the gorgeous red rocks. We absolutely loved our room -- the Sundance Room -- which was very romantic with its jacuzzi tub, fireplace and cabin feel. We also had a very nice view of the red rocks from our balcony. The breakfasts were very delicious and Ron and Cheryl had a lot of information and brochures to share with us regarding things to do in Sedona. We will definitely return to the Inn!
reviews.title: Room and staff lacked attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whirlpool tub in our room had sour water and mold in jets and mold growing in grout. Room spelled like fireplace smoke. Staff very friendly but unknowledgable of how to get the satilite television channels to work and didn't offer to find out or offer to address the smokey smell in our room. Only gave us a candle to burn to help with the smoke smell. Our room was in the main building and it was very noisey. Bed was very comfortable and the location of this bed and breakfast couldn't be beat! Breakfast was good! Property and staff seemed a bit tired.
reviews.title: perfect B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this trip at the last minute and was fortunate to get a room before peak season began. Our room was spacious and beautiful. The grounds, courtyard and lodge were also very pleasing. The owners and staff were very friendly. We noticed there was much attention to detail, impeccable cleansiness and overall fine workmanship. There was even a playable guitar in the room that I often used. The service and food was very convenient and pleasant. As we walked the courtyard there were numerous song birds singing throughout the day with spectacular mountain views. Our host often left bread baking or fresh cookies in our room while we were out in addition to daily cleanup and turndown services. Complimentary snacks, bottled water, coffee, hi speed wireless, robes, day towels provided. I really don't know what more to ask for. We have travelled often and found this to be one of the most pleasant vacation bnb's. We hope to return to Sedona and stay in the Lonesome Dove villa again.
reviews.title: Romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were more than pleased when we found a B&B willing to accomodate a family with a 10 month old, and upon arrival were shocked by the quality of the facility. Our room was larger than spacious, and I felt like we were at a resort: our bed was turned back each evening, fresh cookies were on our bed, afternoon tea was served with appetizers. I was also pleasantly surprised to find aveda products in the bath. The team couldn't have made us feel more welcome or comfortable. We also were able to see some of the "upscale" rooms, and will definitely be booking one of these when we return to Sedona in the future!
reviews.title: a WONDERFUL end to a trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Graham Inn two weeks back. Toroweap, the suite that we could get, had a lovely view of the rock that it's named after and a chic living and dining set up with a bread machine and a fresh loaf when you want it. It's perfect for a small family or two couples, just for two it's a bit pricey. The bed, a bit small for anyone used to a King, has memory foam, very comfortable if you like it, and extra heavy comforters to cuddle under. A patio runs outside along the length of the suite, perfect for balmy nights. Away from uptown, the Inn is located off the main route but is very quiet. The breakfasts, served in the main building, are simply delicious. It also has a pretty backyard where you can enjoy the afternoon appetizers. The hosts, Ron and Cheryl, are friendly and professional. We would love to go back.
reviews.title: Gourmet everywhichway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Adobe Village Graham Inn in Sedona. I reserved a two-bedroom thru Expedia. For the $300/night price tag, I found the accommodations to be very disappointing. The heating in the apartment was in the ceiling. It is fairly chilly in March so, we had to turn on the heat. It was cold when the heat was off, and hot when it was on. The accommodations were clean, but the place needed updating. The drapes were thin, no lining, and cheap. I thought that breakfast was included in the price, but it was not. Very disappointing for the price. The location is quite a way from town which was inconvenient as well.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This charming Inn has both guest rooms and Villas. We stayed at a villa named "Lonesone Dove". A very large western style room with a king bed so comfortable and plush you never want to leave. A large rock fireplace opened to two plush leather chairs for the quiet time. We entered the bathing area through a saloon door. It consists of a dressing area, sink, waterfall shower, jacuzzi hot tub built into a hugh wine barrel, rocking chair and pot bellied stove. Every day we had fresh bread baking in our villa and cookies that were out of this world. Breakfast consisted of 3 to 4 courses and absolutely delectable. Appetizers were served at 5:00. Golf nearby and outstanding restaurants. Set in the beautiful red rocks of Sedona it couldn't have been more perfect. Gracious hosts are an added bonus. We will continue to make this our special getaway.
reviews.title: An Ultimate Romantic Getaway

description: Adobe Village Graham is a Luxury Bed and Breakfast in the heart of the Red Rocks of Sedona.
